verses.roman:
ei mata gāya, nāce, kare aṭṭahāsa
loke upadeśe,--'hao caitanyera dāsa'

synonyms: ei mata—in this way; gāya—chant; nāce—dance; kare—do; aṭṭa-hāsa—laughing like madmen; loke—unto the people in general; upadeśe—instruct; hao—just become; caitanyera dāsa—servants of Śrī Caitanya.
translation: Thus they dance, sing and laugh like madmen, and they instruct everyone, "Just be loving servants of Lord Caitanya."
